alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 08 at 4:22AM PST until November 09 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches, with highest amounts over the higher terrain. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Central and Eastern Lake County. This includes portions of Hwy 31, 395 and 140, and the communities of Paisley, Summer Lake, Lakeview, and Valley Falls. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall coverage and intensity will increase this afternoon. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
